qas.question: What was William Gerard Hamilton's nickname?
Who was William Gerard Hamilton's private secretary?
When did Burke become the Prime Minister's private secretary?
Who invited Burke to join the Freemasons?
What political party was Charles, Marquess of Rockingham in?
What country was Burke the Chief Secretary for?
What year did Burke go with Hamilton to Dublin?

context: At about this same time, Burke was introduced to <b6_0>William Gerard Hamilton<b6_0/> (known as "<a0_0><b5_0>Single-speech Hamilton<b5_0/><a0_0/>"). When Hamilton was appointed Chief Secretary for <b7_0>Ireland<b7_0/>, <a1_0>Burke<a1_0/> accompanied him to Dublin as his private secretary, a position he held for three years. In <a2_0><b8_0>1765<b8_0/><a2_0/> Burke became private secretary to the liberal <a4_0>Whig<a4_0/> statesman, <a3_0>Charles, Marquess of Rockingham<a3_0/>, then Prime Minister of Great Britain, who remained Burke's close friend and associate until his untimely death in <b9_0>1782<b9_0/>. Rockingham also introduced Burke as a Freemason.
